newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Hurricane to buy Kazakh Yuzhneftegaz.
newsitem.headline: Hurricane to buy Kazakh Yuzhneftegaz.

text.p: Canada's Hurricane Hydrocarbons Ltd will sign a contract to buy 80 percent of the Kazakh oil production association AO Yuzhneftegaz on November 30, a senior Kazakh official said on Wednesday.

Sarybai Kalmurzayev, chairman of the State Property Committee, told a news conference that Hurricane had promised to invest $280 million within six years with investment peaking in the second and third years.
If Hurricane breaks the investment schedule, it will pay $45 million in fines, he said.
In August Hurricane said it would pay $120 million for its stake in Yuzhneftegaz.
Kalmurzayev said Hurricane would pay $530 million in royalties within 20 years and $1.7 billion in taxes.
He said that Hurricane would also own Yuzhneftegaz's 50 percent stake in the Kumkol-LUKoil joint venture.
He said Kumkol-LUKoil owed $17 million to Yuzhneftegaz.
Yuzhneftegaz deposits, including Kumkol, hold 581 million barrels of oil. Kumkol's annual production amounts to 12.6 million barrels.
Yuzhneftegaz's debts amount to $120 million, Kalmurzayev said.
